entry.title: MATLAB 内置的文学编程工具 3---MATLAB notebook
entry.content:
Introduction

Contents of Notebooks

  • Microsoft Word documents
    • text
    • MATLAB commands
    • Output
  • An interactive MATLAB session

Creating or Opening a MATLAB Notebook

  • configuring Notebook (for Word 2010: notebook -setup)
  • notebook
  • converting a word document to notbook

Using Notebook

Note:

  • A good way to learn the various techniques in matlabroot/notebook/pc/Readme.doc.
  • When you work on more than one MATLAB Notebook in a single word-processing session
    • Each notebook uses the same "copy" of MATLAB.
    • All notebooks share the same workspace.
    • You can protect the integrity of your workspace by the clear command as the first autoinit cell in the notebook.
  • If you change a cell, it can contain inconsistent data:
    • Input cells that depend on either the contents or the results of the changed cells do not automatically recalculate.
    • Consider selecting Evaluate MATLAB Notebook periodically
  • Do not use debugging functions or the Editor while evaluating cells within a MATLAB Notebook
    1. Complete debugging files from within MATLAB.
    2. Clear all the breakpoints.
    3. Access the file using notebook.

Input cells and Output cells

  1. Type the command into the MATLAB Notebook as text
  2. Point in the command, then Notebook—Define Input Cell, or Alt-D
  3. Alt-U to undefine cells
  4. Notebook—Evaluate Cell, or Ctrl+Enter to get the output cell
  5. Notebook—Purge Selected Output Cells, or press Alt+P to delete output cells.

Cell group

  1. Use the mouse to select the input cells that are to make up the group
  2. Notebook—Group Cells or press Alt-G.
  3. Notebook—Evaluate Cell or press Ctrl+Enter to get output
  4. Notebook > Evaluate MATLAB Notebook or press Alt+R.
  5. Text or numeric output always comes first, regardless of the order of the commands in the group.

Note:

  • A cell group cannot contain output cells.
  • A cell group cannot contain text.
  • If you select part or all of an output cell, but not its input cell, the cell group still includes the input cell.

Autoinit input cells

  • It specify MATLAB commands be evaluated automatically each time a MATLAB Notebook opens. (quick and easy way to initialize the workspace)
  • It is an input cells with the following additional characteristics:
    • The autoinit cells evaluate when MATLAB Notebook opens.
    • The commands in autoinit cells display in dark blue characters

Calc zones

  • It partitions a MATLAB Notebook into self-contained sections
  • It prepares problem sets, making each problem a separate calc zone that can be created and tested on its own.
  • A notebook can contain any number of calc zones.
  • Notebook—Evaluate Cell or press Ctrl+Enter to get output

Printing and formatting a notebook

  • Cell markers do not print.
  • Input cells, autoinit cells, and output cells (including error messages) print according to their defined styles.

entry.title: MATLAB 内置的文学编程工具 2---MATLAB markups
entry.content:
Reference: MATLAB help—MATLAB—User's Guide—Publishing MATLAB Code

Overview

Introduction

Publish formats:

  • HTML
  • XML
  • LaTeX
  • Microsoft Word

Contents can be published:

  • Commentary on the code,
    • bulleted and numbered lists,
    • bold and monospace font,
    • preformatted text,
    • LaTeX equations
  • MATLAB code
  • Results of running the code
    • output results
    • figures

Using code cells

  • Any code cell features can be used for publishing
  • Only comments at the start of a cell will be published

Process for Publishing

  1. Open the file in MATLAB Editor
  2. Cell—Insert Text Markup
  3. Publish the file
    • File—Publish file name: HTML published in /html
    • File—Publish Configuration for file name—Edit Publish Configurations for file name, then publish

Notes:

  • To display the commented text as explanatory text, rather than MATLAB code, insert a cell break before the explanation.
  • MATLAB publishes output generated by code immediately after the end of the cell that contains the code.
  • create a section header without including a cell break: %%%

Mark up MATLAB comments for publishing

Overview

  • Aims of marking up
    • Polish the text file of code for publication
    • Single-source code with documentation
  • Ways of marking up
    • Cell—Insert Text Markup (better for long commentary and descriptions)
    • Type the markup directly (better for short inline comments)

Document title and introductory text

At the beginning of the file 

%% DOCUMENT TITLE
% INTRODUCTORY TEXT

Exported as h1 in HTML (large size, bold font)

Title for the new section

At the beginning of the section 

%% SECTION TITLE
% DESCRIPTIVE TEXT

Exported as h2 in HTML

Preformatted Text

%%
%
%  PREFORMATTED
%  TEXT
%

NOTE: DON'T delete the two spaces after %

Exported as text

  • Monospaced
  • Literal (maintains white space and does not wrap long lines)

Syntax highlighted sample code

%%
% 
%   for i = 1:10
%       disp x
%   end
%

NOTE: DON'T delete the three spaces after %

Bulleted or numbered lists

% * ITEM1
% * ITEM2
% * ITEM3 is a very long
% one. NO problem

NOTE: To create a multiline list item, break the line as desired, but do not insert the list item symbol (* or #) before the second line.

External Graphics

%% Image Example
% This is a graphic:
%
% <<FILENAME.PNG>>
%

NOTE:

  • FILENAME.PNG is relative to the publish folder
  • Supported image types for output file formats
Output file format types of images you can use
doc any format that MS Office supports
ppt any format that MS Office supports
html any format publishes successfully
xml any format publishes successfully
latex any format publishes successfully
pdf bmp and jpg

HTML markup

% <html>
% 
% </html>

NOTE: only for HTML export

LaTeX markup

% <latex>
% 
% </latex>

NOTE: only for LaTeX export

Inline LaTeX math equations

% An inline equation: $x^2 + e^{\pi i}$

NOTE: supports all output types for LaTeX math equations, except Microsoft PowerPoint

LaTeX display math

% $$x^2 + y^2 = 1$$

Force a snapshot of output

%% Scale magic Data and Display as Image:

for i=1:3
    imagesc(magic(i))
    snapnow;
end

Bold, italic, and monospaced text

% *BOLD TEXT*
% _ITALIC TEXT_
% |MONOSPACED TEXT|

Trademark symbols

% trademark symbol (TM)
% registered tradmark symbol (R)

Hyperlinks

Overview

  • HTML and XML export: dynamic or static hyperlinks
  • MS Word: static hyperlinks
  • dynamic hyperlinks
    • point the reader to MATLAB code or documentation
    • the link to run code
  • static hyperlinks
    • link to a web location (URL)

You can include (print version) or exclude (web version) the URL string from a static hyperlink.

Static hyperlinks and publishing URLs

% <http://www.mathworks.com>

Static hyperlinks without publishing URLs

% <http://www.mathworks.com MathWorks>

Dynamic hyperlinks

NOTE: need MATLAB running, not in Microsoft Word

Link to run code
%% Recycling Preference
% Click the preference you want:
%
% <matlab:recycle('off') Disable recycling>
% <matlab:recycle('on') Enable recycling>
Link to a file
%%
% See the <matlab:web(fullfile(matlabroot,'toolbox','matlab','codetools','publish.m')) code> 
% for the publish function.
Link to a MATLAB function reference page
%%
% See the help for the <matlab:doc('publish') publish> function.
Effect of copying hyperlinked text from the MATLAB window

Solution: cleaning up text markup before publishing

Mark up MATLAB code for publishing

Overview

  • Control the position of figure outputs
  • interweave comments, code, and output to draw readers' attention to certain parts

Specifying the display of code output

  • A cell break directs MATLAB to publish the code and output contained in that cells.

entry.title: MATLAB 配色和字体
entry.content:
用惯了深色背景的编辑器，于是想把 MATLAB 的配色也换的眼睛舒服点。

很容易 就找到了 MATLAB 的 zenurn 配色。运行一次就行了。但是在 cell mode 下的高亮很刺眼。这个需要手动在 File—Preferences—Colors—Programming Tools—Cell display options 里改一下。

如果你不喜欢这个配色了 File—Preferences—Colors, Restore Default Colors 就行了。

相对于现在屏幕的大小，默认的字体大小偏小。看个帮助都费劲。 File—Preferences—Fonts—Custom 选择自己喜欢的字体和大小就可以了。帮助字体在 HTML Proportional Text 里改。

entry.title: MATLAB 内置的文学编程工具 1---MATLAB code cells
entry.content:
Reference: MATLAB User's Guide—Desktop Tools and Development Environment—Editing and Debugging MATLAB code—Evaluate Subsections of Files Using Code Cells

Introduction

Definition

A code cell contains the contiguous lines of code that are evaluated as a whole.

Usage

  • Evaluating sections of code in the Editor
    • experiment with code
    • debug
    • fine-tune
  • Publishing MATLAB files

Notes

  • MATLAB code files (.m files) only.
  • MATLAB considers the entire file to be a single cell; therefore, the first line in a file does not have to begin with %%.

Process for evaluating sections of files

  1. MATLAB Editor: Cell—Enable Cell Mode
  2. Define code budaries by %%
  3. Use cell features
    • Quick navigation
    • Evaluate the code in a cell
    • View results of a cell
    • Experiments with different values in cells

Define code cells

Implicit cell boundaries

  • Top and bottom of the file
  • Function declaration and function end statement (If you define an explicit cell break in a function)
  • Lines containing the start and end of the language construct (If you define an explicit cell break within a language construct)

Define explicit cells

  • Cell—Insert Cell Break
  • Click the Insert cell break button
  • %%
  • Select code lines and Cell—Insert Cell Breaks Around Selection

Cell titles

  • Text on the %% line called cell title. (following a space)

Highlight code cells

  • Current cell is highlighted by default

Turn off highlighting

  1. File—Preferences—Colors—Programming Tools
  2. Under Cell display options, clear Highlight cells

Set a highlighting color

  1. File—Preferences—Colors—Programming Tools
  2. Under Cell display options, select Highlight cells
  3. Select the color you like

Fix cell highlighting problems

Syntax errors brings problems to cell highlighting

This feature is turned on by

  1. File > Preferences > Code Analyzer
  2. Select Enable integrated warning and error messages.

Remove/Merge code cells

  1. Delete one % : the line changes to a standard comment
  2. Delete the entire %% line

Nested Cells

Associate Code Cell Breaks with Subfunctions

Place the cell break within the subfunction, rather than above the subfunction declaration. (Because of the implicit cell breaks by MATLAB)

Navigate among cells in a file

  • Normally use Ctrl-<Down> and Ctrl-<Up>
  • Go—Go to or Ctrl-<g> is used for large files

Evaluate cells

Evaluate code cells in a file

  • Run the cell code even if the file contains unsaved changes (good for debugging)
  • The file does not have to be on the search path.
  • The results display in the Command Window, figure window, or elsewhere.

Break points

  • breakpoints are ignored in cell evaluation. This means you cannot debug while running a single cell.
  • To use breakpoints, choose Run/Continue in the Debug menu.

Function files

  • You can define and evaluate cells in MATLAB function files (add the necessary variables to the base workspace)

Modify values in a cell

  • Using value modification tool in the cell toolbar to modify numbers in a cell can automatically re-evaluates the cell. (good for code experiment and fine-tunes)
  • You can also use (-, +, /, and *)

entry.title: 开发环境搭建
entry.content:
Cochlear 公司提供的模块只能在 MATLAB 2012a 及以下的版本运行。这带来不少的麻烦。需要完成配置

  • 软件环境：
    1. Windows 7 64-bit
    2. MATLAB 2012a 64-bit 1
    3. Windows SDK 7.1, or Visual Studio 10.0 Professional with SP1
    4. Speedgoat driver 7
  • 硬件环境：
    1. Desktop PC
    2. Speedgoat target machine
      • 1615 (new)
      • 1273 (old)

出现的问题

安装 Windows SDK 7.1 失败

Installation of the "Microsoft Windows SDKfor Windows 7" product has reported the following error: Please refer to Samples\Setup\HTML\ConfigDetails.htm document for further information.

参考 Microsoft Support

To resolve this issue, you must uninstall all versions of the Visual C++ 2010 Redistributable before installing the Windows 7 SDK. You may have one or more of the following products installed:

  • Microsoft Visual C++ 2010 x86 Redistributable
  • Microsoft Visual C++ 2010 x64 Redistributable

After uninstalling the Microsoft Visual C++ 2010 Redistributable products, you may install the Windows 7 SDK. After installing the Windows 7 SDK, you may then reinstall the newer version of the Visual C++ 2010 Redistributable products, in order to restore the Visual C++ 2010 Redistributable products to their original state.

配置 MATLAB & xPC

  1. Run MATLAB as administrator
  2. Set mex compiler by mex -setup
  3. Set xpc compiler by xpcsetCC -setup
  4. Set target kernel by rtwintgt -setup

安装 speedgoat driver

  1. Download the latest driver
  2. Go to the driver folder
  3. Run speedgoat_setup
  4. Restart MATLAB

配置 target machine

Run xpcexplr on 32-bit MATLAB to set target machine

Note: you will get error on 64-bit MATLAB

IP address 192.168.7.1
TCP/IP target port 22222
LAN subnet mask address: 255.255.255.0
TCP/IP gateway address 255.255.255.255
TCP/IP target driver I8254x
Multicore CPU support enable
Graphic mode enable

Run the commander tools on 64-bit MATLAB to set target machine

参考： MATLAB hep system "xPC Target"—"User's Guide"—"Configuring Environment From the MATLAB Command Line" 

 1: tgs=xpctarget.targets;
 2: tgs.makeDefault('TargetPC1');
 3: env=tgs.Item('TargetPC1');
 4: env.HostTargetComm='TcpIp';
 5: env.TcpIpTargetAddress='192.168.7.1';
 6: env.TcpIpTargetPort='22222';
 7: env.TcpIpSubNetMask='255.255.255.0';
 8: env.TcpIpGateway='255.255.255.255';
 9: env.TcpIpTargetDriver='I8254x';
10: env.SecondaryIDE='on';
11: env.MulticoreSupport='on';

Make a boot disk on the host PC

Run speedgoatmachineboot

Transfer the kernel and make a boot disk

  1. Insert the boot disk to an USB port of the target machine
  2. Restart the target machine to load the new kernel
  3. Check the display information of the target machine
  4. For the new target machine (1615), you have to disconnect the USB keyboard when it boots up, otherwise it will fail (strange). You can reconnect the keyboard after it boots up.

配置 host PC

  1. Connect the host and the target via a Ethernet cable. Make sure that the cable inserts to the correct "Host Link" port.
  2. Set IP address (TCP/IPV4) of the host
    • IP address: 192.168.7.2
    • Subnet mask: 255.255.255.0

测试 host-target 通讯连接

  1. xpctargetping success
  2. xpctest success
  3. Speedgoat full system test (run demos)

Footnotes:

1

这里必须说一下，如果 64-bit 的 Windows7 安装了 32-bit 的 MATLAB，将无法 使用 xPC 连接 target machine。
